intro: Tapeinosperma grandiflorum, commonly known as the large-flowered tapeinosperma, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically opposite and elliptic in shape, with a smooth surface. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments.
